storyTitle: As Insurance Agent, I want to view confirmation of quote initiation to achieve assurance of successful quote creation

testCases.title: Validate display of quote initiation confirmation
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent
Quote initiation form is accessible and functional
All mandatory fields for quote submission are available
System is connected to quote processing backend
Printer or save functionality is available in browser

steps.action: Navigate to the quote initiation form
steps.expectedResult: Quote initiation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory applicant information fields (name, contact details, address)
steps.expectedResult: All applicant fields are populated with valid data

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory risk data fields (coverage type, coverage amount, risk details)
steps.expectedResult: All risk data fields are populated with valid data

steps.action: Click the Submit button to submit the completed quote
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation screen is displayed within 2 seconds showing successful quote initiation

steps.action: Verify that a unique quote ID is displayed on the confirmation screen
steps.expectedResult: A unique alphanumeric quote ID is clearly visible on the confirmation screen

steps.action: Verify that the confirmation screen shows a summary of submitted applicant data
steps.expectedResult: Applicant name, contact details, and address match the data submitted in the form

steps.action: Verify that the confirmation screen shows a summary of submitted risk data
steps.expectedResult: Coverage type, coverage amount, and risk details match the data submitted in the form

steps.action: Locate and click the Print option on the confirmation screen
steps.expectedResult: Print dialog opens with confirmation details formatted correctly for printing

steps.action: Complete the print action or cancel the print dialog
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation details are printed successfully or print dialog is closed without errors

steps.action: Locate and click the Save option on the confirmation screen
steps.expectedResult: Save dialog opens allowing user to save confirmation details as a file (PDF or other format)

steps.action: Save the confirmation details to a local directory
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation details are saved successfully and file can be opened to verify content

postconditions: Quote is successfully created in the system with unique quote ID
Confirmation screen remains accessible for review
Confirmation details are available in printed or saved format
Agent can proceed to next workflow steps
Quote data is stored in the database

testCases.title: Ensure confirmation is only visible to submitting user
preconditions: Two different user accounts exist: User A and User B
Both users have Insurance Agent role and valid credentials
User A is logged into the system
Quote initiation form is accessible
System enforces user-level security for quote confirmations

steps.action: Log in to the system as User A
steps.expectedResult: User A is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the quote initiation form as User A
steps.expectedResult: Quote initiation form is displayed for User A

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory fields with valid applicant and risk data as User A
steps.expectedResult: All required fields are populated with valid data

steps.action: Submit the completed quote as User A
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation screen is displayed to User A with unique quote ID and data summary

steps.action: Note the unique quote ID and confirmation URL displayed to User A
steps.expectedResult: Quote ID and URL are recorded for later verification

steps.action: Verify that User A can view all confirmation details including quote ID and submitted data summary
steps.expectedResult: User A has full access to view the confirmation screen with all details

steps.action: Log out User A from the system
steps.expectedResult: User A is successfully logged out and session is terminated

steps.action: Log in to the system as User B using different credentials
steps.expectedResult: User B is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Attempt to access User A's confirmation screen by navigating to the confirmation URL or quote ID
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message (e.g., 'Unauthorized access' or 'Confirmation not found')

steps.action: Verify that User B cannot view any details of User A's quote confirmation
steps.expectedResult: No quote ID, applicant data, or risk data from User A's submission is visible to User B

steps.action: Verify that the system does not display sensitive information in the access denial message
steps.expectedResult: Error message is generic and does not reveal quote details or User A's information

postconditions: User A's quote confirmation remains secure and accessible only to User A
User B is unable to access User A's confirmation details
System security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
No data breach or information leakage occurs
Both user sessions are properly managed

storyTitle: As Insurance Agent, I want to receive error messages during quote initiation to achieve clarity on issues preventing submission

testCases.title: Validate display of specific error messages on invalid submission
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent
Quote initiation form is accessible and functional
Form validation rules are configured and active
Mandatory fields include: applicant name, contact number, email, address, coverage type, coverage amount
System validation engine is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the quote initiation form
steps.expectedResult: Quote initiation form is displayed with all fields visible

steps.action: Leave the applicant name field empty
steps.expectedResult: Applicant name field remains blank

steps.action: Leave the contact number field empty
steps.expectedResult: Contact number field remains blank

steps.action: Leave the email field empty
steps.expectedResult: Email field remains blank

steps.action: Leave the coverage type field unselected
steps.expectedResult: Coverage type field has no selection

steps.action: Click the Submit button with multiple mandatory fields empty
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is prevented and error messages are displayed within 1 second

steps.action: Verify that a specific error message is displayed for the missing applicant name field
steps.expectedResult: Error message reads 'Applicant name is required' or similar specific message near the name field

steps.action: Verify that a specific error message is displayed for the missing contact number field
steps.expectedResult: Error message reads 'Contact number is required' or similar specific message near the contact field

steps.action: Verify that a specific error message is displayed for the missing email field
steps.expectedResult: Error message reads 'Email address is required' or similar specific message near the email field

steps.action: Verify that a specific error message is displayed for the missing coverage type field
steps.expectedResult: Error message reads 'Coverage type must be selected' or similar specific message near the coverage type field

steps.action: Verify that all fields with errors are visually highlighted or distinguished
steps.expectedResult: Fields with missing data are highlighted with red border, background color, or icon indicating error state

steps.action: Verify that error messages provide guidance on how to correct each error
steps.expectedResult: Each error message includes actionable guidance (e.g., 'Please enter applicant full name', 'Please provide valid email format')

steps.action: Fill in the applicant name field with valid data
steps.expectedResult: Applicant name field is populated and error highlighting is removed from this field

steps.action: Fill in the contact number field with valid data
steps.expectedResult: Contact number field is populated and error highlighting is removed from this field

steps.action: Fill in the email field with valid data
steps.expectedResult: Email field is populated and error highlighting is removed from this field

steps.action: Select a valid coverage type from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Coverage type is selected and error highlighting is removed from this field

steps.action: Fill in all remaining mandatory fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields are populated with valid data and no error indicators remain

steps.action: Click the Submit button to resubmit the corrected quote
steps.expectedResult: Form submission succeeds without errors and confirmation screen is displayed with quote ID

postconditions: All validation errors are resolved
Quote is successfully submitted and created in the system
No error messages are displayed on confirmation screen
User receives confirmation with unique quote ID
Form data is saved to database

testCases.title: Ensure error messages do not expose sensitive data
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent
Quote initiation form is accessible
Form contains fields that may contain sensitive data (SSN, credit card, bank account, medical information)
Validation rules are configured to detect invalid data formats
System security policies prohibit exposure of sensitive data in error messages

steps.action: Navigate to the quote initiation form
steps.expectedResult: Quote initiation form is displayed with all fields

steps.action: Enter an invalid format for a sensitive field (e.g., invalid SSN format like '123-45-678X')
steps.expectedResult: Invalid SSN data is entered in the field

steps.action: Enter invalid data in other fields that may contain sensitive information (e.g., invalid credit score, invalid medical condition code)
steps.expectedResult: Invalid data is entered in multiple sensitive fields

steps.action: Click the Submit button to trigger validation
steps.expectedResult: Form validation is triggered and errors are detected

steps.action: Review all error messages displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Error messages are displayed for fields with invalid data

steps.action: Verify that error messages do not display the actual invalid SSN value entered
steps.expectedResult: Error message reads 'Invalid SSN format' or 'Please enter valid SSN' without showing '123-45-678X'

steps.action: Verify that error messages do not display any partial sensitive data (e.g., last 4 digits, masked values)
steps.expectedResult: No portion of the sensitive data is visible in error messages

steps.action: Verify that error messages do not expose internal system information (database fields, table names, validation logic)
steps.expectedResult: Error messages contain only user-friendly text without technical or system details

steps.action: Verify that error messages do not reveal information about other users or quotes
steps.expectedResult: Error messages are specific to current submission only and contain no references to other data

steps.action: Check browser console and network logs for any sensitive data exposure
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive data is logged in browser console or visible in network response payloads

steps.action: Verify that all error messages provide generic but helpful guidance without exposing confidential information
steps.expectedResult: Error messages are actionable (e.g., 'Please enter valid format') but do not contain sensitive or confidential details

postconditions: No sensitive data is exposed in error messages
User receives clear guidance to correct errors without security risk
System maintains security compliance standards
Error handling does not create data breach vulnerability
Form remains in editable state for corrections

storyTitle: As Insurance Agent, I want to navigate through the quote initiation process efficiently to achieve a streamlined user experience

testCases.title: Validate step-by-step navigation with progress indicators
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent with valid credentials
User has permissions to create quotes
Quote initiation system is accessible and operational
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge - latest versions)
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the quote initiation page and click 'Start New Quote' button
steps.expectedResult: Quote initiation process begins and displays the first step (Applicant Data). Navigation controls (Next, Previous, Save) are visible at the bottom. Progress indicator shows Step 1 of 4 with visual representation (e.g., progress bar or step numbers). Current step is highlighted.

steps.action: Enter valid applicant data in all required fields (Name, Contact Information, Address)
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input correctly. Required field indicators are displayed. No validation errors appear for valid data.

steps.action: Click 'Next' button to proceed to the next step
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to Step 2 (Risk Data). Progress indicator updates to show Step 2 of 4. Previous step is marked as completed. Entered applicant data is saved automatically. Navigation transition completes in under 1 second.

steps.action: Enter valid risk data in all required fields (Property Type, Coverage Amount, Risk Assessment)
steps.expectedResult: All risk data fields accept input correctly. Field validations work as expected. No errors are displayed for valid entries.

steps.action: Click 'Previous' button to return to the Applicant Data step
steps.expectedResult: System navigates back to Step 1 (Applicant Data). Progress indicator updates to show Step 1 of 4. All previously entered applicant data is retained and displayed correctly. No data loss occurs.

steps.action: Click 'Next' button to return to Risk Data step
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to Step 2 (Risk Data). Previously entered risk data is retained and displayed correctly. Progress indicator shows Step 2 of 4.

steps.action: Click 'Next' button to proceed to Step 3
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to Step 3 (Additional Information/Coverage Details). Progress indicator updates to Step 3 of 4. All previous data is saved. Navigation controls remain visible and functional.

steps.action: Complete Step 3 fields and click 'Next' to proceed to the Review step
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to Step 4 (Review and Submit). Progress indicator shows Step 4 of 4. All entered data from previous steps is displayed in a summary format for review.

steps.action: Review all entered information and click 'Submit Quote' button
steps.expectedResult: Quote is submitted successfully. Confirmation message is displayed with quote reference number. Progress indicator shows completion (100%). User is redirected to quote confirmation page or dashboard.

postconditions: Quote is saved in the system with status 'Submitted'
Quote reference number is generated and stored
All entered data is persisted in the database
User can access the submitted quote from their dashboard
Navigation progress is reset for next quote initiation
System logs the successful quote submission with timestamp

testCases.title: Ensure navigation is responsive and accessible
preconditions: User is logged in as an Insurance Agent with valid credentials
Quote initiation system is accessible
Multiple test devices/browsers are available (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile)
Screen reader software is installed and configured (JAWS, NVDA, or VoiceOver)
Accessibility testing tools are available
Different screen resolutions are configured for testing (1920x1080, 1366x768, 768x1024, 375x667)

steps.action: Access quote initiation page on a desktop browser with 1920x1080 resolution
steps.expectedResult: Page loads correctly. Navigation controls are fully visible and properly aligned. Progress indicators are clearly displayed. All buttons and form fields are appropriately sized and spaced. No horizontal scrolling is required.

steps.action: Resize browser window to 1366x768 resolution
steps.expectedResult: Page layout adjusts responsively. Navigation controls remain visible and functional. Progress indicators adapt to smaller screen size. All interactive elements remain accessible and clickable. Content is readable without zooming.

steps.action: Access quote initiation page on a tablet device (iPad or similar) in portrait orientation (768x1024)
steps.expectedResult: Page renders correctly for tablet screen size. Navigation controls are touch-friendly with adequate tap targets (minimum 44x44 pixels). Progress indicators are visible and clear. Form fields are appropriately sized for touch input. Virtual keyboard does not obscure important content.

steps.action: Rotate tablet to landscape orientation and verify navigation
steps.expectedResult: Page layout adjusts to landscape orientation. Navigation controls remain accessible. Progress indicators are still visible. No content is cut off or hidden. All functionality remains intact.

steps.action: Access quote initiation page on a mobile device (iPhone or Android) with 375x667 resolution
steps.expectedResult: Page is fully responsive on mobile screen. Navigation controls are stacked or collapsed appropriately. Progress indicators are visible (may be simplified for mobile). All buttons are touch-friendly. Content is readable without horizontal scrolling. Mobile-optimized layout is applied.

steps.action: Navigate through all steps using only keyboard (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Space keys)
steps.expectedResult: All interactive elements can be accessed via keyboard. Tab order is logical and follows visual flow. Focus indicators are clearly visible on all focusable elements. 'Next' and 'Previous' buttons can be activated with Enter or Space. No keyboard traps exist. Skip navigation links are available.

steps.action: Enable screen reader (JAWS, NVDA, or VoiceOver) and navigate through the quote initiation process
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces page title and main heading. Progress indicators are announced with current step and total steps. Form labels are properly associated and announced. Navigation buttons have descriptive labels announced. Error messages and validation feedback are announced. ARIA landmarks and roles are properly implemented. All content is accessible in logical reading order.

steps.action: Use screen reader to navigate backward and forward through steps
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces step changes. Progress updates are communicated. Data retention is confirmed through screen reader feedback. Navigation state changes are announced appropriately.

steps.action: Test color contrast and visual accessibility using accessibility tools (WAVE, axe DevTools)
steps.expectedResult: Color contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards (minimum 4.5:1 for normal text). Progress indicators are distinguishable without relying solely on color. Navigation controls have sufficient contrast. No accessibility violations are reported for navigation components.

steps.action: Verify navigation performance across all tested devices
steps.expectedResult: Navigation transitions complete in under 1 second on all devices. No lag or delay in button responses. Progress indicator updates are smooth. Page rendering is optimized for each device type.

postconditions: Navigation is confirmed functional across all tested devices and screen sizes
Accessibility compliance is verified for WCAG 2.1 AA standards
Keyboard navigation is fully operational
Screen reader compatibility is confirmed
Performance benchmarks are met across all platforms
Test results are documented for compliance records
